basis: The user explicitly states they are not ready to try anything today, will wait for a cooler space, and may only consider a tiny ultra-passive 60-second body awareness check-in if it truly comes from them. No concrete action is taken in this message.
cognitive_dissonance: Tension between wanting to engage with self-care steps and feeling overwhelmed by heat and anxiety around eating; a strong preference for autonomous, self-initiated action conflicts with distress about trying something.
negative_thought_patterns: Anxiety-focused rumination about eating; avoidance of exposure to intake; all-or-nothing thinking about readiness; anticipate loss of control when attempting steps.
emotional_triggers: Heat stress, anxiety around eating, fear of discomfort, desire for autonomy and safe pacing.
coaching_notes: Maintain a patient, autonomy-centered approach. Offer ultra-passive, optional micro-steps only when the user signals readiness. Avoid pushing actions today and plan for check-ins in cooler space when they feel ready. Reinforce that pacing is acceptable and progress can be gradual.
